meanings.definition: Unable to see distant objects clearly; myopic.
meanings.sent1: The nearsighted owl couldn't spot the moon in the sky.
meanings.sent2: She had to wear glasses because she was nearsighted and couldn't read the board.
meanings.sent3: The nearsighted detective mistook a tree for a suspect in the dark.
meanings.sent4: His nearsighted view of the world made him miss out on the bigger picture.
meanings.sent5: The nearsighted artist painted beautiful details up close but missed the grand landscape.

meanings.definition: Focused on or concerned with the near or immediate; short-sighted.
meanings.sent1: The nearsighted planner only thought about today's tasks.
meanings.sent2: Being nearsighted, he didn't consider the long-term consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent3: The nearsighted squirrel stored all its nuts in one spot, forgetting about winter.
meanings.sent4: Her nearsighted approach to life made her miss out on future opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The nearsighted student focused so much on the quiz that she forgot about the final exam.
